title: Ticket #1773: condor_q is significantly slower due to new classads
description:
When running condor_q against a queue of 100k jobs, I found that 7.5 after the introduction of new classads takes 4 times as long to complete as before new classads.

The main reasons for the slowdown that I have found are:

  1. linear searches in ClassAdList

  2. creating an intermediate copy of the classad in compat_classad::ClassAd::initFromStream

  3. expensive ClassAd instantiation due to initialization of expr and name iterators that may not even be used

  4. on the schedd side, putOldClassAd() is slow because iterating through a hash_map appears to be fairly expensive

  5. on the schedd side, when applying a projection of which attributes to send, it constructs a temporary ad; deletion of this ad is fairly expensive, again due to iteration through the hash_map

The patches that I have committed to address the above problems make condor_q on 100k jobs perform at the same speed as the same test in 7.4.
remarks:
2010-Dec-12 16:07:21 by danb:
My optimizations to ClassAdList made it incompatible with shallow copying as done by qsort of arrays in the negotiator containing ClassAdList. This has been fixed.
check_ins:
2010-Dec-12 15:53   Check-in [19637]: ClassAdList was incompatible with qsort(). #1773 My recent optimizations to ClassAdList made it incompatible with being shallow copied, as done by qsort() in the negotiator. (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Dec-09 09:34   Check-in [19612]: Fix a pointer bug in my previous commit to ClassAdList. #1773 (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Dec-01 14:40   Check-in [19505]: Revert "Revert "Avoid linear searches in compat_classad::ClassAdList. #1773"" This reverts commit df864428457342783c855db06e899789b3822741. (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Dec-01 14:40   Check-in [19506]: Fix my previous commit which broke sorting of ClassAdList. #1773 (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Nov-29 17:07   Check-in [19498]: Revert "Avoid linear searches in compat_classad::ClassAdList. #1773" This reverts commit 0b8203df18f16d47d87494ea3049f4e8870554c6. (By Greg Thain )
2010-Nov-17 21:49   Check-in [19445]: Make collector use more efficient method of sending a "projected" ad. #1773 This is the same optimization that was applied to the schedd for condor_q. Instead of constructing an intermediate ad, just pass the list of attributes as a whitelist to putOldClassAd(). (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Nov-17 21:21   Check-in [19444]: Optimized compat_classad::ClassAd::put(). #1773 (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Nov-16 18:20   Check-in [25764]: Documented performance fixes for condor_q. #1773 (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Nov-16 18:08   Check-in [19410]: Optimized initialization of classad_compat::ClassAd. #1773 Instantiating iterators for iterating over attribute names and expressions turns out to be fairly expensive, so now this is only done when needed. (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Nov-16 18:08   Check-in [19409]: Optimized compat_classad::ClassAd::initFromStream(). #1773 Avoid creating a temporary copy of the classad and avoid creating two of the intermediate copies of the classad expression strings. (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Nov-16 18:08   Check-in [19408]: Avoid linear searches in compat_classad::ClassAdList. #1773 This speeds up condor_q and likely a few other things when dealing with large lists of ads. (By Dan Bradley )
creator: danb
